overview.question: What was the Apollo 11 flight like?
overview.answer: The Apollo 11 Moon Landing was a roughly 8-day mission (July 16–24, 1969) that took three astronauts—Neil Armstrong, Buzz Aldrin, and Michael Collins—from Earth to the Moon and back.

emergency.question: Did an emergency happen on the Apollo 11?
emergency.answer: An emergency did not occur on the Apollo 11 Moon Landing; the mission experienced tense moments during landing but no in-flight accident or life-threatening system failure.

disaster_analysis.question: What was the aftermath of the Challenger mission?
disaster_analysis.answer: The Space Shuttle Challenger disaster concluded that the immediate technical cause was failure of the O-ring seals in a field joint of the right solid rocket booster.

crew.question: Who was on the Apollo 11 flight?
crew.answer: The crew of the Apollo 11 Moon Landing were Neil Armstrong (commander), Buzz Aldrin (lunar module pilot), and Michael Collins (command module pilot).

technical.question: What type of rocket did the Apollo 13 use?
technical.answer: The Apollo 13 mission was launched using a Saturn V rocket.

timeline.question: How long was the Challenger mission?
